posts.name:
Shelli K. Spence, CRU
Shelli K. Spence, CRU
posts.content:
"Operations is boring. Sales is where the action's at!"

Said someone who‚Äôs never seen elite ops in action.

Sure, ops doesn‚Äôt bring in revenue directly‚Ä¶
But without it, sales can‚Äôt deliver.

A high-performing ops team is sexy as hell. Here‚Äôs why:
‚Üí Less chaos = higher morale.
‚Üí Efficient systems = more profits.
‚Üí Smooth workflows = fewer bottlenecks.
‚Üí Seamless processes make Sales look good.
‚Üí Execution becomes an art form; precision is hot.
‚Üí It attracts top talent; pros want a company that delivers.
‚Üí It creates happy clients. Happy clients mean more sales.

Bottom line?

As an ops leader, I've seen this firsthand:

Sales is the driver, but ops is the engine.

Without a well-oiled machine,
Even the best driver can't win the race.

Have you ever benefited from a rock star ops team? OR:
On the other hand, have you ever worked on one?

comments.commentText: Jon Leslie  In some ways yes (more "dopamine hits" in that kind of work), but in other ways, no. Like when a sale falls through.

posts.commentAdded: Absolutely! A stellar ops team fuels success. It‚Äôs the backbone that empowers sales to shine. Cheers to the unsung heroes of the business!

posts.name:
Neil Sarkar
Neil Sarkar
posts.content:
We talked to 50 sales teams and got an earful about their admin nightmares. Turns out, admin work isn‚Äôt just a headache‚Äîit‚Äôs a full-blown vibe killer. 

Here‚Äôs what they had to say:

1. CRMs: Love-Hate Relationship: CRMs are supposed to help, but they often feel like a black hole for time and energy.
One rep confessed, ‚ÄúUpdating the CRM is my Sunday night punishment for having a life.‚Äù
Another joked, ‚ÄúIf I wanted to write essays, I‚Äôd go back to school.‚Äù

2. Reports: The Weekly Slog Reports are the necessary evil everyone loves to hate. Sales reps spend hours making them look pretty for leadership.
‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt sign up to be a spreadsheet artist,‚Äù one rep sighed.
The average rep loses 6 hours a week to reporting‚Äîthat‚Äôs a lot of coffee breaks lost.

3. Manual Processes: Seriously? From commission calculations to approval requests, manual tasks are productivity killers. ‚ÄúWhy are we doing this manually in 2025? Did automation skip our office?‚Äù the reps quipped.

4. Collaboration Chaos Sales, CS, and Marketing: the Bermuda Triangle of communication.
Reps described it as ‚Äúherding cats with different KPIs.‚Äù

What‚Äôs the Fix? It‚Äôs not another overpriced SaaS tool or trust-fall exercises at the next offsite. The solution is better processes and smarter tools that actually save time.

That‚Äôs where we come in.

At, we design AI agents that seamlessly integrate with Salesforce to automate the mind-numbing stuff‚Äîlike data updates, report generation, and manual approvals. So your team can stop being admins and start being closers.

TAKEAWAY: Your sales team doesn‚Äôt need more pep talks or pizza parties. They need freedom from admin drudgery. Free them, and watch their productivity (and morale) skyrocket.

What‚Äôs the admin task your team complains about the most? Drop it in the comments‚Äîunless you‚Äôre too busy updating your CRM.

comments.commentText:
One of my favorite interview questions is ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs your opinion of CRM systems?‚Äù It‚Äôs purposefully open ended. 

In regards to reporting, alignment on core KPI‚Äôs from the c suite to the sales rep is important. There a a lot of inefficiencies that arise when different levels of the org are evaluating different data points.

posts.commentAdded: Great insights! Its time we prioritize efficiency and let our sales teams focus on what they do best‚Äîclosing deals! Whats your teams biggest admin hurdle?

posts.name:
Nick Huber
Nick Huber
posts.content:
If you aren‚Äôt rich, every single business you start needs to be cashflow positive within two months.

If it isn‚Äôt, go get a job working for somebody who knows how to make money or a rich person with a big idea.

Sounds silly but this is why most people fail. Poor early decisions.

comments.commentText: Solid advice‚Äîearly cash flow is the lifeline of any new business, especially without a safety net. Learning from those who‚Äôve mastered the game is a shortcut to gaining valuable insights and avoiding costly mistakes.

What keeps my business sustainable is not assuming success too early.

I don‚Äôt calculate how much I could make if I quit my job right now.
Instead, I‚Äôm waiting for my business to completely replace, or exceed my day job income before making that move.

posts.commentAdded: Great insight! Early cash flow is crucial to sustainability. Learning from others can lead to better decision-making and eventual success.

posts.name:
Jason Bay
Jason Bay
posts.content:
Sure, cold email is hard right now. 

But dude, we gotta stop playing the blame game. 

It's not because of poor deliverability rates. It's not because of spam filters. And it's not because people don't use email anymore.

It's because your email probably sucks. You use copy/paste templates. Sending the same emails to multiple people with different jobs.

And not personalizing.

What do you expect to happen?

Alright, rant over. Let's talk about what to do about it.

Lesson today: Make sure your emails are "mobile ready."

has some great data on cold emails:

- Prospects are 8x more likely to open emails on their phone
- Short and mobile-optimized emails see 83% more replies
- Emails under 50 words get 60% more replies than emails with 150+ words

If your emails aren‚Äôt short and mobile-optimized, you will not likely get a response.

- Word count: Keep emails under 75 words
- Mobile ready: Use short, 1-2 sentence paragraphs

The basic formula looks like this:

 Reason: Why you‚Äôre reaching out to the prospect
 Problem: Speaks to the prospect‚Äôs potential problem(s)
 Social proof: References relevant work with similar companies
 Call-To-Action (CTA): Speaks to prospect‚Äôs priorities and problems

===

Example #1: A company that sells electronic document capture software to clinical operations leaders

Subject line variations:
- FAPI
- Startup timelines
- FDA approval

Hi Frank,

Reason  Saw that you just got FDA approval to proceed with the Fibroblast Activation Protein Inhibitor (FAPI) clinical trial.

Problem  As you launch this trial, we usually hear that manual paper systems and Excel databases create extra work that could delay startup dates.

Social Proof  We‚Äôre helping operations leaders capture trial data more easily to shorten startup timelines to under 4 weeks.

CTA  Worth a quick chat?

Jason

===

Example #2: A company that sells software to help contact centers reduce incoming calls

Subject: Interconnection cost reduction

Reason  Saw the announcement of the interconnection cost reduction initiative, Anne.

Problem  Usually, that means there‚Äôs a focus on reducing incoming support calls and pushing customers to self-serve. Support leaders oftentimes run into challenges knowing which digital investments are actually deflecting calls.

Social Proof  We helped Constellation dramatically reduce cost to serve by finding the sources of increased call volumes.

CTA  Can I share those insights with you?


===


You can't get away with mediocre cold emails anymore.

Tighten up your message. Optimize for mobile. And invest more time to improve your copywriting skills.

Tomorrow, I'm partnering up withto teach the Cold Email playbook we've taught to AE/SDR teams at Shopify, Gong, Rippling, Zoom, and many more.

Register here to join us:

comments.commentText:
I‚Äôm starting to disagree. Outbound is more about not sounding like every other salesperson than applying best practices.

Single line sentences + specific detail in every line will become the new gold standard - BC this is where AI struggles
This is a solid framework to start with. I hope more sellers prospect see this

posts.commentAdded: Great insights! Personalization and brevity are key. Excited to see the Cold Email playbook in action‚Äîthanks for sharing this valuable info! üöÄ

posts.name:
Dan Goodman
Dan Goodman
posts.content:
From HR Troll to client referral. I had a full circle moment. 

I post regularly about deceitful HR practices to warn unsuspecting and trusting employees not to be taken advantage of.

HR and many in leadership don‚Äôt like it. I am exposing their wrongful and harmful practices, making it harder for them to get away with it. Encouraging people to stand up to it. To call it out and expose it and the people doing it.

As a result, I get some pretty ridiculous and insulting comments from these supposed leaders. We can all see right through what their intent is. They never address the point of the post, rather questioning my motivation, my experience, or how often it actually happens, rather than the fact that it happens at all.

Anyway, I digress. I had a full circle moment when I got a private DM from an HR person who on occasion gives me a hard time on my posts. Which BTW when done with respect and logic is welcomed and appreciated.

My new HR friend was friendly with a female VP at her company who was being mistreated by their employer. She reached out to me to help her get a better severance offer and stand up against the wrongdoing.

It just goes to show, the people protecting their turf know what really goes on, whether they want to admit it or argue the opposite for the sake of protecting their turf.

They know how bad it is, they‚Äôve seen it happen or been forced to do it repeatedly.

Pretty wild stuff. From HR troll to referral.

comments.commentText: you post about deceitful HR practices then blast this for all to comment and talk about on LinkedIn - Just curious but do ytou know what Confidential means?
I feel like HR gets a bad rap. HR is sent to do the C levels dirty work.. and this just proves it!

posts.commentAdded: Incredible journey! Your courage to expose HR issues can truly empower others. Heres to standing up for whats right! üí™‚ú® #ChangeMaker

posts.name:
Richele Black ü•ï
Richele Black ü•ï
posts.content:
A few weeks ago, a leader asked me to look at his writing.

On the surface, it checked all the boxes:

 It read smoothly.
 It showcased his expertise.
 It looked polished and professional.

But as I reviewed his words, I realized something important was missing‚Ä¶

Ô∏è HEART

When he spoke about his work, you could hear the passion in his voice.

But on ‚Äúpaper‚Äù? It was nowhere to be found.

_____

This is a common pitfall for many B2B leaders.

They stick to the basics:

üü† We‚Äôre raising more funding
üü† We‚Äôre speaking at this conference
üü† We‚Äôre introducing these new product features

But they often leave out the human side ‚Äî stories, experiences, or insights like:

üü† The problem the funding will help solve
üü† The customer challenge that sparked their conference talk
üü† The groundbreaking research that drove them to expand their solution

______

Here‚Äôs why the ‚Äújust the facts‚Äù approach falls short:

People buy with emotion. Then, justify with facts.

If your content doesn‚Äôt make people feel something, it won‚Äôt inspire them to act.

And that means it won‚Äôt help you achieve your goals.

______

Once I explained this to the leader, he made a few simple changes:

 Added a real-world example
 Shared a behind-the-scenes moment
 Highlighted a relevant customer success story

Just like that, his straightforward info turned into a compelling narrative that made his content much more interesting and persuasive.

_____

Remember, your goal isn‚Äôt just to share what you‚Äôve accomplished.

It‚Äôs to inspire your audience to take action.

So, the next time you create content, don‚Äôt stop at the facts.

Bring in the heart Ô∏è

Because facts alone don‚Äôt win customers.

______

P.S. What's one way you bring more heart into your writing? Let me know in the comments.

comments.commentText: So true! A founder shared what confidence meant to her the other day, and it moved me, inspiring me to be strong during this challenging time for SaaS.

posts.commentAdded: Absolutely love this perspective! Adding heart transforms messages and drives genuine connections. Storytelling is key! üí°‚ù§Ô∏è #Inspiration

posts.content:
One of modern day football's icons - ƒ∞lkay G√ºndoƒüan appears on an Indian podcast, The Ranveer Show.

In my eyes, this one is for INDIAN FOOTBALL. Hope this conversation furthers football culture in our beautiful country.

But of course, if you're a fan of European football, like so many of us... this conversation is a deep dive into the mind of a world class baller.

-Germany national team captain.
-Man City, Borussia Dortmund & FC Barcelona Legend.
-Champions league winner.
-Part of a treble winning team (League champs, European Champs and National Cup champs... happens very rarely in football)

But what are his vulnerabilities?
How has he gotten so far as a professional athlete?
How does a day in his life look like?
How's men's mental health evolving in world football?

A must watch conversation for football fans as well as podcast listeners globally.

The plan is to further collaborate with Manchester City & other premier league clubs.

Do spread the word, wish to make football mainstream in our homeland!

Watch now, onpodcast:

comments.commentText: An inspiring conversation! It's great to see efforts towards growing football culture in India and sharing insights from world-class athletes.

A Game-Changer for Indian Football
The appearance of ƒ∞lkay G√ºndoƒüan, a modern-day football icon, on an Indian podcast is a monumental moment‚Äînot just for football enthusiasts but for the future of the sport in our country.
This conversation bridges the gap between Indian and global football, offering a rare glimpse into the life of a true legend. From captaining the German national team to leaving a legacy at clubs like Manchester City, Borussia Dortmund, and FC Barcelona, G√ºndoƒüan has achieved what many only dream of. Yet, this podcast isn‚Äôt just about his triumphs; it‚Äôs a deep dive into his vulnerabilities, his mental resilience, and what it truly takes to stay at the pinnacle of world football.
It‚Äôs an inspiration for aspiring footballers in India and a step toward building a vibrant football culture in our homeland. By showcasing such profound discussions, we‚Äôre not just celebrating a legend but setting the stage for collaborations with Premier League clubs and global powerhouses like Manchester City.
Let‚Äôs spread the word and make football mainstream in India, uniting fans and players alike under one beautiful game. This isn‚Äôt just a podcast‚Äîit‚Äôs a movement.

posts.commentAdded: Exciting to see ƒ∞lkay G√ºndoƒüan share his insights! This is a fantastic step towards elevating Indian football. üåü‚öΩ #FootballForAll
